p:
In addition to those offered by regulators at the national or regional level, the WHO made available 2 global pathways for facilitating access to medical products in emergency situations: (1) the WHO Emergency Use and Listing, which aims to provide guidance to United Nations procurement agencies and regulators of WHO member states on the quality, tolerability, and performance of inÂ vitro diagnostics
10 ; and (2) the WHO prequalification program, which aims to assess the quality, tolerability, and efficacy of medicinal products for priority diseases.
